item.description:
For the love of Pete: How many times do I have to attempt to update this blasted site?!! Next meetup will be Sunday, February 5 at 5PM, same bat time, same bat channel: a.k.a. Starbucks. It's close to the T's Green line (Arlington Station), so hopefully it is easily accessible to most people. This location has a great downstairs section which usually has very few customers, save a few identity-challenged pre-teens of dubious gender who have found a secret Wi-Fi hot spot where they can look at lord-knows-what on their computers. For our purposes, it tends to have ample seating... and great people watching if you arrive early.

We've lately been discussing Q&A from Robert Mayhew's new book, Ayn Rand Answers, which is a compilation of her answers to questions from many speaking engagements over the years. However, if you feel inspired to bring up any current events, news-worthy items, movies, books, etc., which we could discuss from an Objectivist standpoint, please feel free.

Hope to see you in February.



I have to pay meetup.com $19.00 per month to use their site, so if anyone is willing to donate a couple of green-backs to "the cause" I'd be most grateful. At the last meeting several people put in a voluntary contribution at the end of the gathering. Oddly enough, it had overtones of passing the collection plate at church, but I enjoy that kind of irony, so we'll probably continue to collect money in that fashion.

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group

item.name: The Boston Ayn Rand February Meetup
